title: Queue and Deque Quiz
description: Test FIFO reasoning, BFS ordering, and sliding-window deque logic.

questions.question: Queue semantics are:
questions.explanation: First element inserted is removed first.

questions.question: BFS shortest-path guarantee in unweighted graphs depends on:
questions.explanation: Queue order explores nodes by increasing edge distance.

questions.question: In sliding window maximum, deque should store:
questions.explanation: Indices let you remove elements that leave the window.

questions.question: Before reading current window max from deque, you should:
options: Drop indices that are out of window
questions.explanation: Expired indices at the front must be removed first.

questions.question: Monotonic deque window-max complexity is usually:
questions.explanation: Each index is appended and removed at most once.

questions.question: If processing must prioritize newest task first, queue is usually:
questions.explanation: Newest-first behavior is LIFO, which maps to stacks.
